thread.title: New Nissan Leaf to start production in Sunderland by end of this year

author: Graeme Whitfield
title: New Nissan Leaf to start production in Sunderland by end of this year
text:

Nissan will start production of the new electric Leaf by the end of the year, the company has announced. 
Coming on the same day that the plant’s workforce is to receive the Freedom of Sunderland, Nissan announced in Japan that full production of the new Leaf would start in Sunderland and a factory in the USA before the end of the calendar year. 
The two production sites join Nissan’s Oppama Plant in Japan, which is producing the new generation of the world’s best-selling electric vehicle. 
The announcement safeguards existing jobs at the site, which has been producing the current model of the Leaf for the last four years. 
The new model has been launched in Japan, with the vehicle having greater range than its predecessors, plus new features such as a one-pedal driving system, auto-parking technology and an updated design. Read More 
The car is the most popular electric vehicle in the world, with nearly 300,000 having been bought since it was launched in 2010. 
But it is facing increased competition as other automotive manufacturers join the electric vehicle revolution. 
Fumiaki Matsumoto, executive vice president of manufacturing and supply chain management at Nissan, said: “We’re proud to continue manufacturing the Nissan Leaf at three plants globally. Read More Japan Prime Minister insists Japanese investors have faith in the UK after Brexit 
“The Nissan Leaf is the icon of Nissan Intelligent Mobility with its many advanced technologies. Nissan employees in Oppama, Smyrna and Sunderland are excited to continue producing the most popular electric vehicle in the world.” 
Production of the Leaf began at Sunderland in 2013, while a battery plant has been on the site since 2007. 
The battery unit, which employs 300 people, was sold to a Chinese investment group earlier this summer but will still produce batteries for the Leaf. Like us on Facebook
